data.title: Santa Clara 1
data.text: Very good Chinese and Vietnamese food and the service is very good too. The place is very nice and ample parking spaces. Good selection of foods.

data.title: Be careful what you order.
data.text:
I had "mango chicken" and it was one of the more bizarre things I've had. It was a creamy sauce (like cream of mushroom soup) with chicken and mango. The fried rice was about what you'd get at Panda Express but fresher.

The decor looked like what you'd see in P. F. Changs, according to the people I was there with (native-born Chinese).

The dim sum was much tastier, but still not the best.

Sunnyvale continues to disappoint.

data.title: Good East Asian Fusion
data.text: Very good food.  Attentive service.  Nice ambiance.  Good lunch menu.  Mid-range prices for Silicon Valley.  Only real downside is the tiny parking lot.  Recommended.

data.title: Wide menu, great food, cooked from scratch
data.text: Although from the outside this place does not overly impress you, they can cook up a storm here. The menu is endless from the all-day Dim Sum options, to vegetables, to fish, to meats and desserts. Some items are clearly Chineses, some are Thai..definitely an Asian fusion place. Most items are for sharing..this is clearly how they expected you to eat as the portions are huge. I ordered the sea bass in a soy & rice wine and got about 10ounces of perfectly poached fish. I would have liked to get the Hot and Sour soup but the waiter confirmed it was for 4 people and more (and was $10)..no option for just one person. Many families were here ordering dish after dish..our waiter would walk by our table showing them off as he knew we were interested. The food did not come out quickly at all, but you could tell it was being prepared to order (thus if you have kids come prepared with toys, crayons etc.). I would like to return to go through their Dim Sum items..actually I'd like to return to order everyhing off the menu but would need to have a large group so I could sample it all !

data.title: Good sized meals
data.text: Wait service a bit slow. Forgot several times our request at the start of our sit down. Food when it did come was hot and very large serves which was great. Party of 3 all enjoyed the meal. Place was overly hot with fans above in the extremely high ceiling did nothing to cool anyone. Tables need spacing away from other customers as you can bang your chair into the person behind you easily. Food was excellent though and very tasty.

data.title: Pan Asian Gourmet
data.text: This is a family favorite since we discovered it about five years ago.  Its extensive menu covers every Asian cuisine, its preparations are beautiful and its food is delicious, often surprisingly creative.  The prawns with walnuts are especially noteworthy, and its offering of vegan choices is long and varied.  The wait staff is pleasant, efficient, unobtrusive and helpful in selecting items on the menu for the uninitiated or the experienced diner seeking something new and different.  The setting is lovely, peaceful and relaxing.  The tables are spaced far apart enough to maintain a sense of privacy for all diners, and the pace of the meal can be flexible enough to accommodate a curtain time or a long, leisurely lunch or dinner.  The restaurant does not close between lunch and dinner so a very long lunch is possible, as is a late one.  This is a superior dining experience  --  oh, and by the way, its portions are generous, so be restrained in ordering or plan on taking home goodies that you will be thrilled to encounter the next day.

data.title: Great Asian fusion place!
data.text: Variety of menu options available representing different countries in Asia.  Some of our favorites: the coconut soup, any of the veggie options with the fake meat (actually quite tasty, try the faux lemongrass chicken), dim sum.  They have mixed drinks for those interested.

data.title: Dim Sum!
data.text:
Tasty dim sum especially Siu Mai, Steamed Pork Buns, Sea Bass Dumplings, and Cream Cheese Crab Puffs.  
Favorite entrees: Eggplant sautéed in garlic sauce, Chili Chicken sautéed with sweet garlic chili sauce, and the Steamed Sea Bass with ginger and scallions. 
And lots of vegetarian dishes to try too!

data.title: Good place for a fast dinner
data.text: Enjoyed the peking duck.  Egg rolls ok.  Very nice people running it and many chinese families eating there so very happy to find it

data.title: Go to Chinese Place
data.text: My family and I love this place to go and and eat and for take out.  We go here at least once a month.  Everything is always good.  We have tried many things on the menu and have not been disappointed.  My daughters like the kids noodles and the potstickers.  We like the shaking beef, and the thai chicken curry.  One of the most interesting things we have tried is the East Meets West Beef which has fried potatoes and beef in it.  One time we had leftovers and my husband fried it up the next morning and put a fried egg over it and now we order an extra just so we can have it for breakfast the next day.  The people are always nice and get our orders done quickly.  It is a family owned place which I like to support.

data.title: Four and a half, really
data.text: Just because 5 is world-class, but this food at least was really superior.  The menu is very broad, we had the shaking beef, the lamb Worcestershire, and the sea bass as entrees, three of the dim sum as appetizers, and the salty fish fried rice.  Each was really good in its own right and each made to be the thing itself, not some lame strike at a tired common denominator.  We got our dinner to go, so I can't say anything about the service, but the food was among the best takeout I've had in many years.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Excellent Asian Fusion
data.text: Wonderful, creative meals using delightful combinations of Asian vegetables and herbs. Sauces are fresh and most flavorful. Generous portions, reasonable prices and good service. I will make this a regular stop when in the area.

data.title: I do not recommend Ginger Cafe in Sunnyvale
data.text:
I do not recommend Ginger Café. After a few bites I told the waiter that I did not care for the lunch. The waiter replied that the next time I should order it less sweet. What he should have done was to ask me if I would like a new lunch selection at no additional price. He did not think of that.

The restaurant played a radio station with commercial advertisements that customers could hear. I do not care to hear commercials; I thought that was insensitive. They should play soft music with no commercials or they should have no music.

On the brighter side:  the soup was good.

I will probably not return.

data.title: Great food, reasonably priced
data.text:
Ginger Cafe has a mixed menu...a little Chinese, a little Thai and some Vietnamese.  At this point I have tried more than half of the dishes offered.  Food is tasty, portions are generous and service is fine for a small, unpretentious, but nicely decorated, Asian restaurant.  The food quality easily  matches PF Chang's across the street at about 3/4 the price.  And, no deafening crowd noise!

A full bar serves up very reasonably priced well drinks, but the wine 'list' is pretty sad.  I always pass on the desserts...they look pretty unimaginative. But, the appetizers and main dishes are definitely worth a visit!

data.title: Ginger Cafe
data.text: Delicious, imaginative Asian fusion food. Always a pleasure to eat at this restaurant! The decor is pleasant, and the service at least OK.

data.title: Hard to find, slow service, huge portions, flavorful spicy food, $10 gift certificate with $40 purchase in February
data.text:
The Ginger cafe is a family owned restaurant with locations in Morgan Hill and Sunnyvale.  I once placed a large food phone order by mistake from the Morgan Hill site instead of the Sunnyvale site, some 30 miles apart.  .  

The Sunnyvale  store is located in a small strip mall hidden from one of the busiest intersections in Sunnyvale -El Camino Real and Mathilda -where two 8 lane roads meet.  Unfortunately you cannot see Ginger Cafe from the intersection, and is hard to find unless you are looking for it.  Across Mathilda is PF Changs restaurant right on the corner of the intersection, anchoring a large shopping center.  Down the street is Sunnyvale Tennis Center within 100 yards of the parking lot.   

We walked in without a reservation on a Saturday evening at 645pm. Majestic cathedral ceilings 18 feet high, with lighted decor.  Mahogony colored wooden tables, scarred through 10 years of use,  with comfortable matching colored wooden chairs with padded backs and bottoms.  Paper napkins instead of cloth napkins, and only one fork instead of two.  No cloth table cloths, but paper place settings.  Small bar with 4 chairs in front of a single TV monitor at the entrance.  About 20 tables of 4 arranged in a semi circle around an Oriental center piece.

The place is packed, and we wait 15 minutes to get seated, another 15 minutes for the order to be placed, and at least 15 minutes for the food to arrive in piecemeal, with the meat dish arriving at least 5 minutes before the rice, and then the cold appetizer plate.  The waitress dressed in all black from head to toe, a la Matrix style, is apologetic about the lengthy delay in getting our food.  This is not good, as the meat gets cold while waiting for the rice.             

Our Chinese chicken salad $9 comes with salad, carrot strips for color, and heated sliced strips of chicken breast, arranged in a colorful presentation.  I would have preferred more dressing, as it is barely noticeable.  The portion is very generous and could have served 4.  We ask for and receive separate plates and forks for the salad.  

The kung pao chicken $12 comes with carrots, onions, mushrooms, celery, peanuts, chili peppers, along with hunks of chicken .  The dish is delicious, but the hunks of chicken are too large for eating without a knife, and should have been cut into smaller bite size pieces.  Again a very large serving, feeding 4.  It goes well with the family size white rice $3.50, which arrives without a top to the rice pot. .   

Finally we get the garlic prawns $16 cooked with hot green jalapenos,onions and  scallions in a small pot dish.  The small bowl contains maybe a dozen prawns, and is to die for.  My late 91 year old mother loved this dish.  This dish is spicy hot, and causes my forehead to break out in a deep sweat.  I quickly drink up both mine and my wife' s glasses of water, before the waiter brings more water.  

We bring along a coupon and with our $40 purchase get a free dessert, 
fried bananas coconut ice cream $7.  This consists of five large scoops of coconut ice cream and four egg rolls filled with hot bananas.  Another deliciously, decadent dessert.

Our bill before tax and tip comes to $40.50, with lots of leftovers.  For the month of February, purchases of $40 or more will get a $10 gift certificate good through August.  We will be back, but next time with a reservation.

data.title: Great Catering Experience
data.text:
We catered lunch from Ginger Cafe for the first time today for our department CNY (Chinese New Year) lunch and had a great experience.  The ordering process included a few calls to Ginger Cafe, more due to questions and decision making on our end; they were more than patient and accommodating.  They recommended 5-6 shallow pan dishes from their catering menu for 16 people.  We took their advice and ordered the following:

Crispy Tofu in Mandarin Sauce
Basil Chicken
Beef with String Beans
Chicken Fried Rice 
Veggie Chow Mien

We also ordered Fresh Shrimp Roll and Lettuce Wrap with Chicken as appetizers. 

The food came piping hot and was delicious.  They provided everything needed such as napkins, utensils, plates, fortune cookies, etc.  The only thing we had to provide was the serving utensils.  Everyone enjoyed themselves.  

I appreciate their great service and quality, tasty food.

data.title: Poor Service Makes It Less Appealing
data.text: The décor is interesting and something which one would expect from a restaurant in Malaysia or Singapore.  The food menu is also intriguing.  However, the service lacks refinement from the too-fast speaking and unfriendly waitress who likes to put her thumb in rice bowls to the rather untrained staff who, although are six-deep chatting around the front entrance, do not bother to say good-bye and thank you to departing customers.  It can get crowded and noisy during the lunch crowd.  The parking lot is a bit tight.

data.title: Excellent Thai/Chinese in Sunnyvale
data.text:
Unique atmosphere...high ceilings and warm, inviting decor. Nice local restaurant among many chain restaurants. 

Tasty food...especially the coconut soup. Good variety on the menu. 

Service was good...it was late but we weren't rushed it made to feel like we needed to hurry at all.

data.title: Ginger Cafe is awesome
data.text: We LOVE this place!  It's as chic and tasty (if not more tasty) than P.F. Changs... but it's WAY less expensive and WAY less crowded.  We would eat there every night if we could.
